about-content-one.message: On Christmas Eve we’ll be proudly showcasing a preview of Santa’s dashboard – the technology that powers his sleigh during his around-the-world journey. We’ve received this special preview from one of Santa’s many developer elves, who are hard at work in the North Pole helping Santa prepare for his big day. Santa’s dashboard – featuring the latest and greatest in Google Maps technology and sleigh engineering – will allow you to follow his progress around the world, and also learn a little about some of his stops along the way.

about-content-three.message: The Google Maps Santa Tracker is created and developed by Google, with a little help from Santa’s elves. Need help or have another question? Visit our Help Centre.

about-content-two.message: Our friendly elves have also invited you to explore Santa’s Village while Santa gets ready for his journey. So go ahead and explore his village – you might just find some fun activities and meet some interesting elves.

about_title.message: Welcome to the Google Maps Santa Tracker!

ar_tradition.message: In Argentina, Christmas begins promptly at midnight. Many families kick off the holiday by hosting festive celebrations in their homes, opening gifts with their loved ones and lighting fireworks in the early hours of the morning.

au_tradition.message: Australia's Southern Hemisphere location means it's summer time in December. Instead of sleigh bells and cocoa, many Australians head to the beach to celebrate the holidays with a prawn lunch and games of cricket.

br_tradition.message: Christmas celebrations start near midnight, usually with big family dinners, gift opening and the celebration of the 'Missa do Galo' (the rooster's mass) in churches. Despite the warm tropical summer weather, themes of winter and snow are not uncommon.

ca_tradition.message: Canadian children usually celebrate a snowy, white Christmas. They bundle up in their scarves and toques, a Canadian woollen hat, to play in the snow, ice skate and toboggan! On Christmas Eve, they leave milk and cookies by the fireplace for Santa (and sometimes a carrot for his reindeer).

citylights-panorama-04-description.message: Champs-Elysees to the Arc de Triomphe

codeboogie-block-leftfoot-tooltip.message: Take a step to the left.

codeboogie-block-rightfoot-tooltip.message: Take a step to the right.

codeboogie-mode-freestyle-description.message: Make your own moves and share with friends

codeboogie-result-missing-block-fail.message: Try the block below to match the dance.

codeboogie-result-missing-block-success.message: Did you know that you can finish this dance with just {{ideal}} blocks? Try using the block below.

codeboogie-result-perfect-success.message: Nice moves! You finished the dance perfectly.

codeboogie-result-too-few-blocks-fail.message: You are using the right blocks, but try using more of them to complete the dance.

codeboogie-result-too-many-blocks-succes.message: Did you know you can finish this dance with just {{ideal}} blocks?

codeboogie-result-wrong-move.message: Seems like you did the wrong move there. Try this one instead:

codeboogie-share-moves.message: Share your moves and challenge your friends

codelab-mwc-promo.message: Explore more Google coding projects at MadewithCode.com.

codelab-result-empty-repeat-fail.message: The "Repeat" block needs to have other blocks inside it to work.

codelab-result-extra-top-block-fail.message: Some of the blocks are not attached together properly.

codelab-result-missing-block-fail.message: Try one or more of the block below to solve this puzzle.

codelab-result-missing-block-success.message: Did you know you can finish this level with just {{ideal}} blocks? Try using the block below.

codelab-result-perfect-success.message: Congratulations! You finished the puzzle perfectly.

codelab-result-too-few-blocks-fail.message: You are using the right blocks, but try using more of them to complete this puzzle.

codelab-result-too-many-blocks-success.message: Did you know you can finish this level with just {{ideal}} blocks?

copy-me.message: Copy this link to share your message

de_tradition.message: In nearly every German town, Christmas markets open in the town square. Townspeople gather to hear brass bands and enjoy traditional fare from the region. They eat gingerbread hearts, sugar-roasted almonds, sweets of all kinds and drink mulled wine (Glühwein) or apple cider.

deckdescription.message: Deck out your browser with a Santa Chrome extension.

donate_text.message: Help fund a special needs project on DonorsChoose.org. This December, we're helping to double the impact by matching donations by 50%, until we reach our goal of donating US$1m. Together, we can help to make classrooms more inclusive #ForEveryKid

download-cta.message: Download to play even more games

endofjourneymessage.message: Santa's finished his journey for the year! He and the elves are still having some fun in the North Pole before their annual holiday.

error.message: There was a problem, but Santa's Elves are looking into it.

error-internal.message: Oh no, there was a problem! We've informed Santa's Elves, but try heading back to Santa's Village.

error-lost-connection.message: Looks like we just lost our connection with the North Pole. Santa's elves are working hard to fix it – stay tuned!

error-not-found.message: Oh no, Santa's Elves can't find this page! You might have better luck if you head back to Santa's Village.

error-out-of-date.message: This is an outdated version of Santa's Village! Try opening Santa Tracker again to see the latest version.

error-unsupported.message: Santa Tracker doesn't support your browser. To play more games and to track Santa on 24 December, try your phone or a different browser.

familyguide_assistant_body_01.message: Use the Google Assistant to find out more about Santa Claus during December! This integration is available in select languages.

familyguide_assistant_body_02.message: With their parents' permission, children under 13 can also have their own personalised Google Assistant experience when they log in with their own account, managed with Family Link.

familyguide_assistant_card01_body.message: Google Assistant connects you with the North Pole, where Santa is busy rehearsing for a musical concert. He only knows one song – can you help him figure out the best way to play it?

familyguide_assistant_card02_body.message: Tune in daily to the North Pole Newscast to find out what Santa and his elves are up to. Just ask the Google Assistant what's new at the North Pole.

familyguide_assistant_card03_body.message: When Santa's not busy with the elves at the workshop, he spends time sharpening up his comedy skills. Just ask the Google Assistant for a Santa joke to hear his routine.

familyguide_assistant_title.message: Never Miss a North Pole Minute

familyguide_body.message: Santa's Village is the perfect place for families to celebrate the season. You'll find all your favourite characters together with fun, educational and interactive activities for every age.

familyguide_card_01_body.message: Use coding fundamentals to navigate the elf through the forest to find dropped presents.

familyguide_card_02_body.message: Create your own festive card by programming your own snowflake – just select one of many backgrounds and share it with your friends.

familyguide_card_03_body.message: The elves are back to coding practice, while mixing in their dancing skills. Use code to choreograph the elves' dances, but watch out – as you get better, the dances get harder!

familyguide_card_04_body.message: From wearing a toque in Canada to sporting swimming trunks in Australia, click the map pins to learn about festive traditions around the globe.

familyguide_card_05_body.message: From Happy New Year in Elvish to Дед Мороз, learn the seasonal lingo from around the world.

familyguide_card_06_body.message: Santa's got a lot of places to go. Match the outline of a country to the map in this geography game.

familyguide_card_07_body.message: Do you know your holiday history? Show your stuff in a nine-question quiz that's sure to test your trivia skills.

familyguide_card_08_body.message: Hungry? Discover delicacies from around the world and explore food from countries near and far.

familyguide_card_09_body.message: Tap into Santa's very own creative suite. Each tool, brush and sticker has a custom sound, making this an audio and visual experience.

familyguide_card_10_body.message: Experiment and play in your own wintery sandbox. Use 3D materials to build anything: houses, toys, snowpeople, forests or anything else that you can dream up.

familyguide_card_11_body.message: Build your own elf from head to toe and make sure that it looks elf-tastic for the many festive soirées happening on the North Pole.

familyguide_card_12_body.message: Santa is in the barber's and he needs help getting a whole new 'do. Colour his beard, blow-dry his hair, add some decorations or shave it all off with the clippers.

familyguide_card_13_body.message: Join the elves, reindeer, Santa and Mrs Claus on a visit to the Museum of Holiday Cheer!

familyguide_card_14_body.message: There's many an elf, reindeer and Pegman to shuttle around the North Pole. Watch how they navigate from place to place.

familyguide_card_15_body.message: Santa and the reindeer are ready to go but they need a little help from the coding elves before takeoff.

familyguide_card_16_body.message: Our Village friends join Ollie the narwhal for a day underwater as they put together the first annual kelp lighting celebration.

familyguide_doublecard_body.message: After all the eggnog is gone and the presents are opened, discover year-round resources for family fun with Google.

familyguide_doublecard_card01_body.message: We all want a healthy planet for today and tomorrow. Learn simple tips from Google to help people and the planet thrive together.

familyguide_doublecard_card02_body.message: To make the most of the Internet, children need to be prepared to make smart decisions. Be Internet Awesome teaches children the fundamentals of digital citizenship and safety so that they can explore the online world with confidence.

familyguide_group_01_body.message: The elves are always working on their coding skills. Explore games that will teach you the basics. Anyone can try their hand at coding!

familyguide_group_01_title.message: Learn to code with Santa's elves

familyguide_group_02_body.message: The festive season can look quite different from place to place. Learn how the world celebrates the season with games and quizzes galore.

familyguide_group_03_body.message: Santa's Village thrives on the magic of making. Discover games that let you draw, paint, build and create with all your favourite characters.

familyguide_group_04_body.message: Grab the popcorn and snuggle in under a cosy blanket. You can catch the whole gang on the big screen at the Village cinema or read along with an interactive storybook as Ollie the Narwhal celebrates the festive season under the sea.

familyguide_secondary_body.message: On 24 December, Santa's Village transforms into a tracking experience where you can follow Santa and his reindeer as they deliver presents to children around the world.

familyguide_secondary_cta_01.message: Follow along on the Santa Tracker website or Android app

familyguide_secondary_cta_02.message: Psst! Did you know, Santa's journey lasts 25 hours?! He makes his first stop just after 10 p.m. local time in far-eastern Russia, when it's 5 a.m. in New York and 11 a.m. in Paris.

familyguide_secondary_title.message: Track Santa on the big day

familyguide_tips_body.message: Get more magic out of Santa Tracker this season with all your favourite Google products.

familyguide_tips_tip01_body.message: Ask the Google Assistant every day for fun updates from Dimplesticks the Elf.

familyguide_tips_tip01_title.message: 'Hey Google, what's new at the North Pole?'

familyguide_tips_tip02_body.message: Download the Santa Tracker app for Android on the Play Store. There's an exclusive Village scene with games that you'll only find in the app.

familyguide_tips_tip03_body.message: Track Santa from your wrist with Android Wear integration.

familyguide_tips_tip04_body.message: Search for 'Santa' on Google to see Santa in 3D. On most iPhones and some advanced Android devices, you can see him in AR, waving right through your camera!

familyguide_tips_tip04_title.message: Bring Santa to your living room

familyguide_tips_tip05_body.message: Bring some festive fun to your messages. Find Santa-themed gifs and stickers by searching for 'Santa Tracker gifs' (English only) on Google's Tenor page.

familyguide_title.message: Festive fun for the whole family

familylink.message: Add your child's Google account, managed with Family Link

fi_tradition.message: Finnish people believe that Father Christmas, 'Joulupukki', lives in the northern part of the country – Korvatunturi, to be exact. If you visit, you might find his secret workshop, where gnomes are hard at work. Or you might find reindeer roaming in pine tree forests.

finished-text.message: Merry Christmas! Santa has completed his journey around the world and is taking a much deserved break. Visit us again next year!

fr_tradition.message: In France, children traditionally put their shoes out next to the fireplace in anticipation of Père Noël's arrival. If children have been good throughout the year, Père Noël will fill the shoes with gifts.

gh_tradition.message: Christmas in Ghana includes the whole family. Adults dress up in costumes and hand out sweets around the neighbourhood. Children decorate their homes with paper ornaments and drawings they make at school.

gr_tradition.message: In Greece, friendly but troublesome creatures called 'kallikántzari' live most of the year in the centre of the earth. But at Christmas, they love to hide in people's houses, frightening people, playing tricks or devouring Christmas foods. Greeks perform rituals to keep these hobgoblins away.

gt_tradition.message: Guatemalans celebrate Christmas with fun and dancing. They wear hats called Puritina, eat Guatemalan-style tamales, light firecrackers at midnight and dance the night away with various styles of dancing.

is_tradition.message: At Christmas time in Iceland, families give gifts of warm clothing to each member of their household. According to legend, there is a frightening Christmas Cat who gobbles up anyone not equipped for the cold and wintery weather. Families work together to ensure that nobody will 'go to the Christmas Cat'.

kg_tradition.message: In Kyrgyzstan, Ayaz Ata (Grandfather Frost) comes at midnight on New Year's Eve and leaves presents under the New Year tree. When the clock strikes midnight, families throughout the country light fireworks to celebrate this beautiful occasion. The cities become as bright as day.

kr_tradition.message: In South Korea, Christmas is a national holiday. It's also known for being a romantic holiday. Many couples go on dates in the city, where streets and shops are trimmed with dazzling lights.

lightdescription.message: Light up your TV with the Santa Tracker Android app and Chromecast.

lt_tradition.message: In Lithuania, traditional Christmas ornaments are made out of straws or hay. They're woven into geometric shapes, like stars, snowflakes or bells. Many families also use straw to decorate the dinner table for a big meal called Kūčios.

meta_description.message: Use Google Santa Tracker to follow Santa Claus on Google Maps as he makes his journey around the world.

mx_tradition.message: In Mexico, children of all ages celebrate Christmas by breaking piñatas. Adults and children have fun by wearing a blindfold, spinning around and swinging a stick to break open the star-shaped hanging pots. When the piñata is smashed open, nuts, fruit and sweets spill out for everyone to enjoy.

nonprofit-agastya-description.message: Agastya brings hands-on science education to children all over rural India. In both their science centres and mobile science vans, they cover everything from the solar system to how the brain works. They have reached over 5 million children and 200,000 teachers across 14 states in India; it’s one of the largest science education programmes in the world! Google.org is proud to be a supporter of Agastya.

nonprofit-code-description.message: Code.org® is a non-profit organisation dedicated to expanding access to computer science, and increasing participation by women and underrepresented students of colour. Code.org®'s vision is that every student in every school should have the opportunity to learn computer science.

nonprofit-donorschoose-description.message: Founded in 2000 by a Bronx history teacher, DonorsChoose.org has raised over US$480 million for America's classrooms. Teachers come to DonorsChoose.org to request the materials and experiences that they need for their classrooms.

nonprofit-enable-description.message: According the CDC, 7 in 1,000 people experience limb differences and prosthetics are expensive – up to £7,000! For growing children, the costs can add up quickly. e-NABLE is a global community of people who work together to make 3D printed hands for children with limb differences. Google.org is helping the Enable Community Foundation in supporting the e-NABLE Community to design more hands and increase the number of kids who can get hands.

nonprofit-instruction-coloring.message: Pick an ornament and start colouring.

nonprofit-instruction-share.message: Share your art with your family and friends so that they can learn too.

nonprofit-intro-type.message: We've partnered with Google.org to showcase five education non-profits that celebrate the season of giving all year long. Scroll down and learn more about how each organisation gives back. Show your support by colouring this collection of ornaments and then hanging them on your tree or giving them to your loved ones.

nonprofit-jane-description.message: Chimpanzees are human beings' closest living relatives in the animal kingdom! Today, there are fewer than 300,000 chimpanzees remaining due to habitat loss, disease and illegal trade. The Jane Goodall Institute (JGI) protects chimpanzees by observing and understanding their behaviour as well as the habitats in which they live. JGI also works to build a community of people who are protecting and conserving wildlife and the environment we share. Explore the Chimpanzee habitats in Gombe, Tanzania.

nonprofit-khan-description.message: Khan Academy is a non-profit organisation with a mission to provide a free, world-class education for anyone, anywhere. Khan Academy believes learners of all ages should have unlimited access to free educational content that they can master at their own pace.

nonprofit-lwb-description.message: Libraries Without Borders is a leading international NGO in culture-based development founded in 2007, headquartered in Paris. It has built more than 300 libraries around the world.

nonprofit-nature-description.message: The Nature Conservancy works to protect and restore forests in the United States and around the world. These iconic forests sustain life around the planet. They filter water, clean our air, support communities of people and provide habitats for important plant and animal species. At the current rate of deforestation, our forests will be wiped out within 100 years. The Nature Conservancy’s Plant a Billion Trees programme is working to plant one billion trees by 2025 and restore the world’s most critical forests.

nonprofit-pratham-description.message: Close to 40% of the global population does not have access to education in a language that they speak or understand. StoryWeaver hopes to change that by helping educators, writers and translators create joyful, supplementary reading resources for children.

nonprofit-rnib-description.message: There are many people in the world who are living with sight loss, but have some remaining vision left. Google.org is helping RNIB develop 'smart glasses' that help people with low vision see shapes and silhouettes more easily. Smart glasses can make the world easier to see, helping people regain their independence and confidence.

nonprofit-solar-description.message: 1.3 billion people have no access to electricity, and many have to use kerosene lamps that burn fuel and pollute homes. Solar lights absorb power from the sun during the day and provide hours of light in the evening without burning or polluting. They can help people to read, play and get home safely at night. SolarAid provides access to solar lights to many who need them. Google.org is proud to be a supporter of SolarAid.

nonprofit-water-description.message: We use water for showers and baths, for cooking, and of course, for drinking. Clean water is a precious resource, and many people rely on hand-dug wells to access aquifers, which hold clean water deep in the ground between layers of rock and soil. charity: water works with local partners to build wells and other water projects where they are greatly needed. Google.org is proud to be a supporter of charity: water.

nonprofit-wheelmap-description.message: It can be difficult for wheelchair users to figure out which places are accessible: Cinemas, Restaurants and wherever else they might travel. Wheelmap shows which places are wheelchair accessible so that wheelchair users can spend less time planning routes and more time exploring the world!

nonprofit-wwf-description.message: Climate change continues to disrupt the balance of many of the world’s ecosystems, in both warm and cold places. In the Arctic, polar bears are losing their sea ice habitat due to rising temperatures, and they face added threats from human activities such as oil and gas development and delivery. World Wildlife Fund works to ensure the survival of the species through scientific research and by working in partnership with native Arctic communities. Google.org is proud to be a supporter of World Wildlife Fund.

nonprofit-wwh-description.message: Research suggests that 95% of people with hearing loss can be treated with hearing aids, but less than 1% of people in low- and middle-income countries who need hearing aids get them. World Wide Hearing (WWH) connects children to their world by providing hearing aids and services. WWH is designing an affordable, tablet-based hearing loss diagnostic tool for use in the developing world to help more people who need hearing aids to receive them.

notice_cookies.message: Google serves cookies to analyse traffic to this site, and to optimise your experience. Information about your use of our site is shared with Google for that purpose.

notification_notice.message: Santa's elves will keep you up to date with Santa's schedule

notification_prompt.message: Keep me up to date with Santa

nz_tradition.message: Because Christmas is in the summer in New Zealand, friends and family gather round a barbecue. Typical Christmas meals include roast lamb, sometimes cooked in a 'hangi' – an underground pit or earth oven. A favourite dessert is pavlova: meringue covered in fresh fruit like strawberries and kiwifruit.

offline_notification.message: Santa's village is now available offline! The elves can also bring you new content throughout December.

ornament-print-instructions.message: Fold here and glue sides together

ph_tradition.message: The Philippines is known for having the world's longest Christmas season. Four months are considered Christmas months: September, October, November, December. Christmas carols can often be heard as early as the beginning of September.

playdescription.message: Play with friends using the Santa Tracker Android app.

press-about-tracker1.message: On 24 December, we'll launch the Tracker, a dashboard that allows Santa fans to follow his progress as he whips from city to city. You can also see his live location on Google Maps and ask the Google Assistant, 'Ok Google, Where's Santa?' – so you can keep a finger on the pulse of Santa's whereabouts even when you're on the go.

press-about-village1.message: Santa's Village is celebrating its fifteenth year of fun, educational and interactive festive activities. Under Mrs. Claus's expert guidance, the elves have updated the village with a snazzy look and feel along with some brand new content. And, thanks to a new, hot-cocoa-powered heating system, the village will no longer take all of December to thaw – all two-dozen activities will be available starting on 4 December. Now the elves (and you!) have more time to play and explore in Santa's Village.

press-about-village2.message: In the village, you can practice basic coding skills, create original artwork, exercise your geographic chops and learn more about charitable organisations like Khan Academy and Code.org. Teachers can even download lesson plans with video guides to help teach their students fundamental coding skills and festive traditions in English, Spanish, French, Japanese and Korean.

press-device-text.message: The spirit of the festive season is everywhere, including all your devices!

press-edu1.message: We've expanded our educator resource page to provide teachers with video guides to accompany lesson plans, now available in five languages. All of your favourite games remain, introducing basic concepts of coding to global festive traditions. Google's Santa Tracker encourages festive learning experiences in a fun way – see our educational games to learn more.

press-need-text.message: Elves and Googlers are here to help.

press-whatsnew1-text.message: Build your own elf from head to toe and make sure that it looks elf-tastic for the many festive soirées happening on the North Pole.

press-whatsnew2-text.message: If your lifelong dream has been to start a dance troupe with a group of highly talented dancing elves, now's your chance. Almost. Using a machine-learning model called PoseNet, you can train an elf to learn your moves, so you can get your elf on the dance floor.

press-whatsnew3-text.message: You'll also be able to see Santa's real-time location on Google Maps – just tap on the hamburger button and then on 'Location Sharing' to see exactly where Santa is throughout his journey. You can also go to https://g.co/findsanta for an easy shortcut!

press-whatsnew3-title.message: A new way to track Santa:

press-whatsnew4-text.message: If you're craving more festive cheer, take a look at the Gboard festive stickers available on Android, iOS, and our Android app. And, enjoy some literary fun by asking the Google Assistant to 'Tell me a holiday story' and 'Where's Santa?'

quickdraw-round-no-new-guess.message: I'm not sure what that is.

quickdraw-rounddetails-also-look.message: Tensor also thought your drawing looked like these:

quickdraw-rounddetails-how-know.message: How does Tensor know what {{thing}} looks like?

quickdraw-rounddetails-it-learned.message: It learned by looking at these examples drawn by other people.

quickdraw-rounddetails-look-more.message: Tensor thought your drawing looked more like these:

quickdraw-splashview-description.message: Is róbat Meaisínfhoghlaim Dhaidí na Nollag é Tensor a chuidíonn le Daidí na Nollag leis na litreacha a fhaigheann sé ó pháistí ar fud an domhain. Tá sé oilte chun téacs agus íomhánna a scaoileadh go tapa agus is breá leis tomhas cad atá duine éigin ag tarraingt. Tarraing pictiúr de gach focal Nollag ar an scáileán agus inseoidh sé duit cad a fheiceann sé.

quickdraw-splashview-title.message: Imir le Tensor, an Róbat a Aithníonn Íomhánna!

quickdraw-timesup-subline-guess-one.message: Tensor recognised one of your drawings.

quickdraw-timesup-subline-noguess.message: Tensor didn't recognise any of your drawings.

ru_tradition.message: Russian children decorate a New Year's tree, instead of a Christmas tree. Children wait with longing for Grandfather Frost who travels with his granddaughter Snowmaiden, delivering presents across the land. Grandfather Frost lives deep in the woods in Veliky Ustyug, in northern Russia.

scene_holidayfoods.message: Google Earth Holiday Foods of the World

share-button.message: Share with your friends on Google+

share-text.message: I created this postcard for you in the Google Santa Tracker. Merry Christmas!

snowball_waiting.message: Waiting for more of Santa's elves

snowflake_choose_postcard.message: Use the arrow keys to pick a postcard

snowflake_code_instructions.message: Snap blocks together to design your own snowflake

snowflake_make_your_own.message: This was made with code. Try it yourself!

snowflake_share_postcard_message.message: Choose a postcard and share your snowflake with friends

snowflake_shared_message.message: Someone has sent you a snowflake!

storybook_new_language.message: Love reading about Ollie's adventure? Try exploring in a new language.

storybook_paragraph_01.message: The penguins were sledging. Elves cheered with delight.

storybook_paragraph_02.message: The whole town was a-buzz for the village tree light.

storybook_paragraph_03.message: Not everyone that day was feeling so jolly. It was a sad day, you see, for a narwhal named Ollie.

storybook_paragraph_04.message: 'I wish, just this once, I could be there to see it. It seems so amazing to watch that big tree lit'.

storybook_paragraph_05.message: 'But you love the ocean!', replied sweet Mary Bear. 'All the seashells and plankton. It's awesome down there!'.

storybook_paragraph_06.message: 'I guess so', said Ollie, 'that's certainly true. But sometimes the big blue makes me feel blue, too!'.

storybook_paragraph_07.message: 'Well what if…', said Mary, with an encouraging smile, 'I came down there today and we swam for a while?'.

storybook_paragraph_08.message: 'Go exploring? Surf sea reefs… Or better yet, I know!'.

storybook_paragraph_09.message: 'We could hold a tree lighting of our very own'.

storybook_paragraph_10.message: A plan had been hatched. Mary gathered her crew. In jumped elves and then penguins. A few reindeer, too!

storybook_paragraph_11.message: Ollie smiled in delight at the friends who had come. 'Let's get to it!', said Mary, 'this is going to be fun!'.

storybook_paragraph_12.message: Now, to throw a great party, the first thing they'd need is a team of great helpers to help them succeed.

storybook_paragraph_13.message: 'Gather around!' Mary shouted. 'We need all your help, to host our very own undersea lighting of kelp'.

storybook_paragraph_14.message: The fish sprung into action, spreading word to the guests. 'We'll handle the invites, you handle the rest!'.

storybook_paragraph_15.message: Now the elves had experience with this sort of event. They'd need time for their tinkering, and so off they went.

storybook_paragraph_16.message: Decorations were next. They knew just who to see. 'Mr Crab and Ms Lobster, would you help, pretty please?'.

storybook_paragraph_17.message: The oysters chimed in, 'We can help with design! Hang our pearls from the branches. They'll sparkle and shine'.

storybook_paragraph_18.message: Every party needs music, tunes with just the right beat, to get everyone grooving and up on their feet.

storybook_paragraph_19.message: 'My uncle Horatio is the best in the biz. And his good friend Carla is a guitar-playing whiz'.

storybook_paragraph_19_disused.message: 'My uncle Horatio is the best in the biz. And his good friend Carl is a guitar-playing whiz'.

storybook_paragraph_20.message: 'It's almost time for the party, so the last thing we'll need is the perfect kelp bundle for a ceremonial tree'.

storybook_paragraph_22.message: Ollie flip-flopped with glee! What a fabulous party this whole night would be.

storybook_paragraph_23.message: Starfish leapt into place and the ornaments swayed. The jellyfish danced and the band members played.

storybook_paragraph_24.message: It was all so fantastic, the decor and the sounds. But the best part was when everyone gathered around.

storybook_paragraph_26.message: The moment was here at long last! The plankton lit up. Ollie let out a gasp!

storybook_paragraph_27.message: It was almost like magic, lights shimmered aglow. The whole town fell silent, just watching the show.

storybook_paragraph_28.message: The most spectacular thing that they'd all ever seen. Lights went yellow, then purple, then bright emerald green.

storybook_paragraph_29.message: Mary started to get sleepy, it was past time for bed, but before they all left, Ollie turned and then said,

storybook_paragraph_30.message: 'Thank you so much for bringing this whole town together, for a night that I know we'll remember forever'.

tracker_flight_nearby.message: Santa is nearby, find out where

tracker_flight_start.message: Santa has departed from the North Pole, and you can now follow his route

trivia_medium_090.message: Timbuktu, a centre of caravan trade for almost a thousand years, is located north of the Niger River in which landlocked country?

trivia_medium_091.message: Which landlocked South American country is bordered by both Chile and Brazil?

trivia_medium_092.message: The city of Belém is located at the southern mouth of the Amazon River in which country?

trivia_medium_093.message: Which river forms much of the northern border of Bulgaria?

trivia_medium_094.message: The Sayan Mountains are located near Lake Baikal in which Asian country?

trivia_medium_095.message: Lake Nipigon is the largest lake in which Canadian province?

trivia_medium_096.message: The Balearic Sea and Ionian Sea are both part of what larger sea?

trivia_medium_097.message: Lake Turkana and Lake Natron are examples of rift valley lakes located on which continent?

trivia_medium_098.message: The Puerto Rico Trench is the deepest point in what ocean?

trivia_medium_099.message: The laughing kookaburra bird is native to the eucalyptus forests in the eastern part of which continent?

trivia_medium_100.message: The Hague, home to the International Court of Justice, is a city on the west coast of which European country?

trivia_ngb_promo.message: Content by the National Geographic Bee

uk_tradition.message: In the United Kingdom, merrymakers of all ages enjoy Christmas crackers on the table at dinner. Crackers are tubes wrapped in colourful paper, with pull tabs on each end. When you pull the tabs, the tube bursts with a loud snap! Inside are paper hats, toys, jokes and prizes to enjoy during Christmas night.

upgrade-warning.message: Oops! Santa Tracker isn't supported in your browser or you have JavaScript disabled. To access Santa Tracker, download a modern browser or enable JavaScript.

us_tradition.message: In the United States, stockings are hung on Christmas Eve. The legend goes that St Nicholas heard of a family in need. To surprise them, he climbed down their chimney and placed precious bags of gold in hanging stockings. From this point, St Nicholas was known as Santa Claus, giver of gifts.

village_comeback.message: Come back on the 24th and help us track Santa all night!

village_explore.message: Explore, play and learn with Santa's elves throughout December
